description: Information about a single microscope channel.
title: Target
name: target

describedBy.description: The URL reference to the schema.

schema_version.description: The version number of the schema in major.minor.patch format.

molecule_name.description: The name of a target molecule (small molecule or gene product) whose distribution is assayed by this experiment.
molecule_name.guidelines: If there is an accompanying codebook, this name should correspond to the target name used in the codebook.

molecule_id.description: An identifier referring to the the target molecule.
molecule_id.guidelines: For small molecules this should be from the ChEBI ontology. For gene products this should be a standard gene or gene product identifier (e.g. ensembl, uniprot).

subcellular_structure.description: Target subcellular structure. This should be a term from the GO cell component ontology.

reagent_name.description: Name of reagent used to detect target.
reagent_name.guidelines: Please list any encoding probes, readout probes, oligonucleotide probes conjugated to secondary antibody.

purchased_reagent_details.description: Information describing purchased reagent used to detect target.

probe_sequence.description: Sequence of a probe used to detect target.

assay_type.description: Type of assay used to detect target.
assay_type.example: MERFISH; smFISH; immunofluorescence; fluorescent cell stain

multiplexed.description: Whether multiple targets were detected simultaneously in this channel.
multiplexed.example: Should be one of: yes, or no.

channel_id.description: Channel ID used to assay signal. Should be consistent with the ID in the channel tab.
